input-digitalinput.help:
With this node it is possible to read the digital inputs from the Venus device. The node only shows the enabled digital inputs, so first make sure to enable the input from the Venus OS GUI (Settings -> I/O -> digital inputs) for the desired readout.

Depending on the selected type of input, different measurements become available.

Also see the section on digital inputs in the Cerbo GX manual.

input-tank.help:
The input-tank node is for retrieving tank level sensor information.

Also see the manual for more information.

input-temperature.help:
Like the other nodes, the input-temperature node reads the temperate information from the dbus. This means that source of the temperature sensor can obtain its information from different sources (e.g. directly connected probe or Bluetooth connected Ruuvi tag).

See the manual for information on connecting a temperature sensor.

input-inverter.help: This node is for reading from the inverter.

input-pvinverter.help: This node is for obtaining information from the PV inverter.

input-accharger.help: The AC charger can be read with this node.

enum.9: Err 9: Battery voltage wire losses too high

input-solarcharger.help: Information from the Solar charger can be read with this node.

enum.9: #9 - Battery voltage wire losses too high
enum.11: #11 - Battery ripple voltage on terminals too high
enum.37: #37 - Input voltage absent (mains removed, fuse blown?)
enum.38: #38 - Input shutdown due to battery over-voltage
enum.39: #39 - Input shutdown due to battery over-voltage
enum.40: #40 - Internal failure (PV Input failed to shutdown)
enum.41: #41 - Inverter shutdown (panel isolation resistance too low)
enum.43: #43 - Inverter shutdown (voltage over ground relay too high)
enum.53: #53 - Inverter dc level (internal dc rail voltage)
enum.54: #54 - Inverter ac level (output voltage not ok)
enum.65: #65 - Device disappeared during parallel operation (broken cable?)
enum.66: #66 - Incompatible device encountered for parallel operation (e.g. old firmware/different settings)

input-battery.help: This node allows for monitoring the state of the battery.

battery.name: Mid-point voltage of the battery bank (V)
Mid-point deviation of the battery bank (%)

input-gridmeter.help: This node gives allows for monitoring the grid. See also energy meters accessoires.

input-vebus.help: Information from VE.Bus connected devices can be obtained with this node.

enum.1: VE.Bus Error 1: Device is switched off because one of the other phases in the system has switched off
enum.2: VE.Bus Error 2: New and old types MK2 are mixed in the system
enum.3: VE.Bus Error 3: Not all, or more than, the expected devices were found in the system
enum.4: VE.Bus Error 4: No other device whatsoever detected
enum.6: VE.Bus Error 6: Error in DDC Program
enum.7: VE.Bus Error 7:  BMS connected, which requires an Assistant, but no assistant found
enum.8: VE.Bus Error 8: Ground relay test failed
enum.10: VE.Bus Error 10: System time synchronisation problem occurred
enum.14: VE.Bus Error 14: Device cannot transmit data
enum.16: VE.Bus Error 16: Awaiting configuration or dongle missing
enum.18: VE.Bus Error 18: AC Overvoltage on the output of a slave has occurred while already switched off
enum.22: VE.Bus Error 22: This device cannot function as slave
enum.24: VE.Bus Error 24: Switch-over system protection initiated
enum.25: VE.Bus Error 25: Firmware incompatibility. The firmware of one of the connected device is not sufficiently up to date to operate in conjunction with this device

vebus.name: BMS allows battery to be charged
BMS allows battery to be discharged

input-gps.help: GPS information can be obtained with this node. For an example usage see the location based scheduling example.

input-ess.help: This node gives information on the energy storage system (ESS).

enum.1: Optimized mode or 'keep batteries charged' and phase compensation enabled
enum.2: Optimized mode or 'keep batteries charged' and phase compensation disabled

enum.3: Optimized Mode /w BatteryLife: self consumption, SoC exceeds 85%
enum.4: Optimized Mode /w BatteryLife: self consumption, SoC at 100%
enum.5: Optimized Mode /w BatteryLife: SoC below dynamic SoC limit
enum.6: Optimized Mode /w BatteryLife: SoC has been below SoC limit for more than 24 hours. Charging the battery (5A)
enum.7: Optimized Mode /w BatteryLife: Inverter/Charger is in sustain mode
enum.8: Optimized Mode /w BatteryLife: recharging, SoC dropped by 5% or more below the minimum SoC
enum.10: Optimized mode w/o BatteryLife: self consumption, SoC at or above minimum SoC
enum.11: Optimized mode w/o BatteryLife: self consumption, SoC is below minimum SoC
enum.12: Optimized mode w/o BatteryLife: recharging, SoC dropped by 5% or more below minimum SoC

enum.1: Optimized mode or 'keep batteries charged' and phase compensation enabled
enum.2: Optimized mode or 'keep batteries charged' and phase compensation disabled

input-meteo.help:
The input-meteo node allows for Solar Irradiance, Temperature and Wind Speed Sensors measuring.

More information and supported devices can be found in the manual.

input-system.help: This input node takes is for retrieving information from the com.victronenergy.system dbus path.

system.name: AC Consumption on Input Number Of Phases
AC Consumption on Output Number Of Phases
PV Power AC-tied on Generator L1
PV Power AC-tied on Generator L2
PV Power AC-tied on Generator L3
PV Power AC-tied on Generator Number Of Phases
PV - AC-coupled on input Number Of Phases
PV - AC-coupled on output Number Of Phases

dcsource.name: Mid-point voltage of the battery bank (V)
Mid-point deviation of the battery bank (%)

input-relay.help: The input-relay node reads the state of the relay(s) of the Venus device.

output-relay.help: The relays of the Venus device can be controled with this node. Make sure to set the relay(s) to Manual via the Venus OS GUI first.

output-vebus.help: This output node is for writing to VE.Bus connected devices.

output-inverter.help: This node can be used for controlling the inverter.

output-accharger.help: This node is for controlling the AC charger.

output-solarcharger.help: With this node the solar charger can be switched on and off.

output-ess.help: This node allows for controlling the Energy Storage System (ESS).

enum.8: Optimized Mode /w BatteryLife: recharging, SoC dropped by 5% or more below the minimum SoC
